posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.24 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here .

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

★ The new and slightly refreshed Signal logo can help you digitally experience the feeling of seeing a good friend right after they get a haircut (but it’s not a completely new hairstyle).
★ Chat folders let you organize your organizations, group your groups, and individualize your individuals into unique folders that are easy to customize and rearrange.

(I know the chat folder note is a repeat, it’s intentional)

Complete list of new commits since 7.23.1
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.23.1…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

Two things to look out for:

  1. Updated icon! Mostly the same, but a little rounding here and there and a deeper shade of blue.
  2. You should be notified in the in-app notes about Call Links. Give them another shot if you haven’t already, and let us know if you run into any issues!

link_counts.title: Ver 7.24.0 - unable to send voice messages
Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.23 release
Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.23 release

posts.cooked:
@updates-bot not working?
Edit: just a slight delay!

New Version: 7.24.0 (148200)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

42 new commits since 7.23.1:

Show commits

  • Add call to action for chat folders. [1]

  • Only show connection warning if not actively connected. [2]

  • Add initial flag / watermark system for backup failure UX. [3]

  • Update to libsignal 0.60.0 [4]

  • Move to separate message and media backup keys. [5]

  • Convert lintchecks build.gradle to KTS. [6]

  • Update lint version to align with AGP. [7]

    Resolves #13759

  • Enable BuildConfig through buildFeatures, not gradle.properties. [8]

  • Remove nonFinalResIds=false. [9]

  • Enable nonTransitiveRClass. [10]

    Resolves #13757

  • Validate sender for quotes. [11]

  • Add support for watermarking backup failure sheet. [12]

  • Be more specific about which blurhashes to throw out. [13]

  • Fix state restore after activity swipe and launch from notification. [14]

  • Fix various UI bugs for chat folders. [15]

  • Fix handling of split message/media cdn backup credentials. [16]

  • Replace message-backups TODO with backups. [17]

  • Remove a couple unnecessary backup TODOs. [18]

  • Replace collectAsState with collectAsStateWithLifecycle. [19]

  • Fix wallpaper migration getting stuck on malformed files. [20]

    Closes #13769

  • Remove unnecessary force and safe checks. [21]

    Resolves #13766

  • Move from enum.values() to enum.entries. [22]

    Resolves #13767

  • Replace System.getProperty('line.separator') with System.lineSeparator(). [23]

    Resolves #13768

  • Fix linked device inactive filtering. [24]

  • Add null checks to some AudioView functions. [25]

  • Stub out a few necessary view model methods. [26]

  • Fix color shading on status bar in app settings. [27]

  • Fix use of media credentials for fetching/restoring media related data. [28]

  • Use libsignal validator to verify backups. [29]

  • Update error strings in alert bottom sheet. [30]

  • Fix blur hash for images and videos. [31]

  • Prevent chat removal from all chats. [32]

  • Update backups bottom sheet data handling. [33]

  • Add new backups category for help fragment. [34]

  • Refactor how archive service access is managed during restore. [35]

  • Update brand logo. [36]

  • Pass in days since last backup to alert sheet. [37]

  • Convert SvrValues to kotlin. [38]

  • Convert StorageSyncJob to kotlin. [39]

  • Convert StorageForcePushJob to kotlin. [40]

  • Update translations and other static files. [41]

  • Bump version to 7.24.0 [42]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.23.1…v7.24.0

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

At least 66 languages changed since 7.23.1:

For technical reasons, not all languages may be listed below. However, everything from “Updated language translations” and similar commits is listed, so the list is likely complete. You can view the full comparison to 7.23.1 so far here.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked: seems to be mostly fixes and behind-the-scenes stuff, plus a folders call-to-action, am I right in that assessment?

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked: @greyson-signal Will the APK be posted in the GitHub releases?

greyson-signal:
  1. about Call Links. Give them another shot if you haven’t already, and let us know if you run into any issues!

10000311631080×1445 43.8 KB

This typo in the Delete Link pop-up has been there since v7.21.5 stable.
The screenshot above is from v7.22.2 stable.
Currently shows:
“This link will no longer work for anyone who as it.”

I’m guessing it should be:
“This link will no longer work for anyone who has it.”

10000311641080×976 73 KB

I can set a long character name for a call, but when I go to edit the name, it’s shown in a one-line field:

10000311651080×1215 21.4 KB

Maybe it should go to the next line and always show the full name as set by the user?

I noticed when sending a Signal Call Link on WhatsApp, the name I’ve set isn’t shown in the URL preview!
Shows fine within Signal.

And what is the character limit for the name of a Call Link?

posts.name: Hugo
posts.cooked:
Aku-Stable:

This typo in the Delete Link pop-up has been there since v7.21.5 stable.

It’s just in UK English /s

hmzuleta:

It’s just in UK English /s

Mancunian accept perhaps

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Not seeing the GitHub release :(

posts.name: Greyson Parrelli
posts.cooked: I just noticed the build to publish to github failed because of a compile error specific to the “website” build variant. Unfortunately to fix it, I’ll have to make another release.
posts.edit_reason: Automatically removed quote of whole previous post.

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked: 9 posts were merged into an existing topic: Discussion about Signal’s new logo

New Version: 7.24.1 (148300)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

6 new commits since 7.24.0:

  • Fix typo in string. [1]

  • Move BillingError to core-util. [2]

  • Limit call link names to 32 characters. [3]

  • Stop marking messages as read after archiving. [4]

  • Update translations and other static files. [5]

  • Bump version to 7.24.1 [6]

posts.cooked: Maybe the details view for call links could show the date and time each call link was created?

posts.name: Peter Gerber
posts.cooked:
After updating, I’m seeing an error trying to send a message with attachment:

11-08 10:57:37.187 16318 16365 E BaseJob : Encountered a fatal exception. Crash imminent.
11-08 10:57:37.187 16318 16365 E BaseJob : java.util.NoSuchElementException: No value present
11-08 10:57:37.187 16318 16365 E BaseJob : 	at j$.util.Optional.get(Unknown Source:9)
11-08 10:57:37.187 16318 16365 E BaseJob : 	at org.whispersystems.signalservice.api.attachment.AttachmentApi.uploadAttachmentV4$lambda$1(AttachmentApi.kt:111)
11-08 10:57:37.187 16318 16365 E BaseJob : 	at org.whispersystems.signalservice.api.attachment.AttachmentApi.$r8$lambda$sZl_hIqT9H7mw-BiTEwfTXptc_g(AttachmentApi.kt:0)

11-08 10:57:37.187 16318 16365 E BaseJob : 	at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.AttachmentUploadJob.onRun(AttachmentUploadJob.kt:178)
11-08 10:57:37.187 16318 16365 E BaseJob : 	at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.BaseJob.run(BaseJob.java:31)
11-08 10:57:37.187 16318 16365 E BaseJob : 	at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobmanager.JobRunner.run(JobRunner.java:88)
11-08 10:57:37.187 16318 16365 E BaseJob : 	at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobmanager.JobRunner.run(JobRunner.java:51)
11-08 10:57:37.189 16318 16365 E JobRunner: [JOB::d1c38de3-bbc9-4a28-b773-ae6881b961d9][AttachmentUploadJob][4] Job failed with a fatal exception. Crash imminent. (Time Since Submission: 17667 ms, Lifespan: 86400000 ms, Run Attempt: 1/Unlimited, Queue: null)

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.24.1/c001a73f264a670a3f47dc41a138426ef31ccee697879c11a8aac2090273ad22

This happened after sharing a file from a different application.

Voice messages also failing to send:
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.24.1/217426e911b4bc8093cbd300dcae8e83fcc3717c0aced4824a4957691609e321

posts.name: Jeffrey
posts.cooked:
Return to Chat List after failing send voice message.

Debug Logs

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.24.1/38b6308eafbaaa44dae1570bf55e8dae0b01bd9e2589412fe49aa4a6614a430a

The app crashes when I try to send any attachment type other than image. mp3, txt, zip, pdf, epub, voice message, everything causes the app to crash. Strangely there’s one particular pdf file that gets sent just fine every time, no idea why.

Everything seems to fail with this exception:

Summary 
E AndroidRuntime: FATAL EXCEPTION: signal-JobRunner-4
E AndroidRuntime: Process: org.thoughtcrime.securesms, PID: 10971
E AndroidRuntime: java.util.NoSuchElementException: No value present
E AndroidRuntime: 	at j$.util.Optional.get(Unknown Source:9)
E AndroidRuntime: 	at org.whispersystems.signalservice.api.attachment.AttachmentApi.uploadAttachmentV4$lambda$1(AttachmentApi.kt:111)

E AndroidRuntime: 	at org.whispersystems.signalservice.api.NetworkResult$Companion.fromFetch(NetworkResult.kt:44)
E AndroidRuntime: 	at org.whispersystems.signalservice.api.attachment.AttachmentApi.uploadAttachmentV4(AttachmentApi.kt:81)
E AndroidRuntime: 	at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.AttachmentUploadJob.onRun(AttachmentUploadJob.kt:178)
E AndroidRuntime: 	at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobs.BaseJob.run(BaseJob.java:31)
E AndroidRuntime: 	at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobmanager.JobRunner.run(JobRunner.java:88)
E AndroidRuntime: 	at org.thoughtcrime.securesms.jobmanager.JobRunner.run(JobRunner.java:51)

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.24.1/a8a434b7ecb3f1d616776a65bd155a820a869cdfaee6b0215ba71ac56fe0d2b2
